Second Founder of the Pala Dynasty

Mahipala I is called the 'Second Founder of the Pala Dynasty' as he revived the declining empire and recovered lost territories.

тЪФя╕П
Chola Invasion

The most significant event of his reign was the invasion of the Ganga valley by Rajendra Chola I (c. 1021-23 CE). Although the Cholas defeated him and took Ganga water, the Cholas did not occupy Bengal, thus Mahipala's kingdom remained secure.

тШ╕я╕П
Religion and Construction

He renovated several Buddhist monuments in Sarnath, Nalanda, and Bodh Gaya.
